content.text:
# Draft:Scott Woodward (branding executive)

}}
Scott Woodward is an American marketing and branding executive. He has held senior marketing roles at major brands like Ray Ban, Calvin Klein, Movado Group, and the Arnell Group. In 2006, he founded SEW Branded, a New York–based brand marketing consultancy, and has served as an adjunct professor at Parsons School of Design since 2021.
Career
Corporate Roles
Woodward began his marketing career in Chevron’s training program in 1987. He later joined Ray‑Ban, where as Global Director of Image Marketing. He consolidated global brand campaigns, launched its first Atlanta flagship during the 1996 Olympics, and led a notable product placement with Men in Black.
In 1997, Woodward joined Calvin Klein as Vice President of Global Marketing and Public Relations, before becoming Global Chief Marketing Officer at Movado Group in 1998, overseeing marketing for brands including Coach, Concord, ESQ, Tommy Hilfiger, and Movado. He later worked with the Arnell Group, collaborating on global brand campaigns across sectors.
Accolades
* Named to George Wayne’s Downtown 100 list of influential New Yorkers (2022)
References
